Converts function pointer to a rpc_callback_t block type.

detaileddescription.para: Definition of RPC event handler block type.

memberdef.definition: typedef bool(^ rpc_callback_t) (rpc_object_t args, rpc_call_status_t status)
memberdef.name: rpc_callback_t

detaileddescription.para: Definition of RPC callback block type.
Closes the connection and frees all resources associated with it.
Subscribes for an event.

This function can be called multiple times on a single event name - subsequent calls will not send a subscribe message to the server, but instead increment internal reference count for a subscription.
Calls to rpc_connection_subscribe_event() must be paired with rpc_connection_unsubscribe_event().
Undoes previous event subscription.

This function may either:
decrement reference count of subscription for given event
send unsubscribe message to the server (when subscription reference count reached value of 0)

parameterdescription.para: Connection to undo the subscription on

detaileddescription.para: Registers an event handler block for an event of a given name.
Each time an event occurs, a handler block is going to be called.

parameterdescription.para: Connection to register an event handler for
Name of an event to be handled

detaileddescription.para: Cancels further execution of a given event handler block for ongoing events of a given name.

parameterdescription.para: Connection to remove event handler from
Name of an event related to event handler
Void pointer to event handler itself

detaileddescription.para: Performs a synchronous RPC method call using a given connection.
Function blocks until a result is ready and returns it, or cancels and returns a NULL pointer if a timeout has occurred.
Method call arguments need to be rpc_object_t instances, followed with a NULL, denoting end of variable argument list.

parameterdescription.para: Connection to do a call on
Name of a method to be called

detaileddescription.para: Performs a synchronous RPC method call using a given connection.

This function is similar to rpc_connection_call_sync(), but instead of taking rpc_object_t arguments, it accepts a format string and a list of values to pack, in format used by the rpc_object_pack() function.

parameterdescription.para: Connection to do a call on
Name of a method to be called

detaileddescription.para: Performs a synchronous RPC method call using a given connection.
Function blocks until a result is ready and returns it, or cancels and returns a NULL pointer if a timeout has occurred.
Instead of variable arguments length in rpc_connection_call() example, this function takes previously assembled variable arguments list structure as its argument.

parameterdescription.para: Connection to do a call on
Name of a method to be called
Variable arguments list structure describing a method arguments

memberdef.argsstring: (rpc_connection_t conn, const char *name, rpc_object_t args, rpc_callback_t callback)
memberdef.name: rpc_connection_call

detaileddescription.para: Performs a RPC method call using a given connection.
Function returns immediately without waiting for a RPC completion and returns rpc_call_t object representing the ongoing call.
Function supports a callback argument of rpc_callback_t type, which is a pointer to a function to be called on RPC completion. Can be set to NULL when that functionality is not needed by the caller.

parameterdescription.para: Connection to do a call on
Name of a method to be called
Variable length RPC method arguments list
Callback function pointer to be called on RPC completion

detaileddescription.para: Sends an event.
Ping the other end of a connection.
Sets global event handler for a connection.

parameterdescription.para: Connection to set event handler for

detaileddescription.para: Sets global error handler for a connection.

parameterdescription.para: Connection to set error handler for

detaileddescription.para: Returns true if a connection has associated remote credentials information.

simplesect.para: true if credentials information is available, otherwise false

detaileddescription.para: Waits for a call to change status.
Requests a next chunk of a result from a call.
When sync is set to true the function waits until the call finishes and returns 1 if it has completed successfully - otherwise the function returns 0.

simplesect.para: 1 for successfully completed RPC when sync flag was set, otherwise 0

detaileddescription.para: Aborts a pending call.

simplesect.para: Function status - success is being reported as 0

detaileddescription.para: Waits for a call to change status.
If a timeout specified by a ts argument occurs, before a call changes its status, function returns -1 value.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, -1 on failure or timeout

detaileddescription.para: Checks whether a call has been completed successfully.

simplesect.para: 1 when call was successfully completed, otherwise 0

detaileddescription.para: Returns a current status of a given call as an integer value castable to rpc_call_status_t.
Returns a call result (or a current fragment).
Frees a rpc_call_t object.
RPC connection API.
